title: API Reference
content:
#


Introduction#

This API Reference provides a comprehensive overview of the conventions
associated with the API. Understanding these elements is crucial for effective
integration and utilization of the API in your applications.




Authentication#

Prerequisites:

 * You must need a client token to access the API. Which you can obtain from out
   admin.

 * You must create a user and obtain an API key

API Keys

Authentication is a critical aspect of using the API, ensuring that only
authorized users can access certain functionalities. The primary method of
authentication is through API keys.

How API Keys Work

 1. Generation: Users can generate API keys from their account dashboard.
 2. Usage: Include the API key in the header of each request as follows:
    X-Api-Key: YOUR_API_KEY
 3. Security: Keep your API key confidential. Do not expose it in client-side
    code or public repositories.

Client Token

 1. Generation: Users can get Client Token from our admin.

 2. Usage: Include the API key in the header of each request as follows:
    X-Client-Token: YOUR_CLIENT_TOKEN

 3. Security: Keep your Client Token confidential. Do not expose it in
    client-side code or public repositories.

Sign-out#




Errors#

The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate the result of API requests.

STATUS CODE   MEANING
200           OK - The request was successful.
400           Bad Request - The request was invalid.
401           Unauthorized - Authentication failed.
403           Forbidden - Access is denied.
404           Not Found - The resource does not exist.
422           Unprocessible Entity - Data validation failed.
500           Internal Server Error - A server error occurred.

Error Object When an error occurs, the API returns an error object in the
response body, which includes the following fields:

 * code: A numeric code representing the error type.
 * message: A human-readable description of the error.
 * details: Additional information about the error (if available).








Templates#

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create a template#



Creates a new template file or replaces an existing one.

Parameters:

The name of the template.

The file to upload.

The schema to validate the data.





--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


List all templates#

Retrieves a list of templates.

Parameters:

The type of file to retrieve, either html or json.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

An object with list property that contains an array of strings
